jmines.view.components
Class MainPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jmines.view.components.MainPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public class MainPanel
extends JPanel

This is the JMines main panel, it contains a top panel with the two LCDs (for the number of flag and the time) the game panel and a status bar at the bottom.

Author:
Zleurtor
See Also:
Serialized Form

Returns:

manageBestTimes

public final void manageBestTimes()
The method used to check if the realized time to win the game is better than the previous ones, if yes display a dialog to ask the user name, then save this time.

playGrid

public final void playGrid(byte difficulty,
                           byte shape,
                           byte width,
                           byte height,
                           byte[][] grid,
                           int mines)
Play a JMines Video using a given list of actions.

Parameters:
difficulty - A byte defining the difficulty used in the video has been saved (beginner, intermediate, expert or custom).
shape - The tiles shape used in the video (triangular, square, hexagonal, etc.).
width - The number of columns in the video grid.
height - The number of lines in the video grid.
grid - A bytes array defining which tiles contain a mine (a tile contains a mine if the byte value of the grid array is 1).
mines - The number of mines contained in the video grid.

playVideo

public final void playVideo(byte difficulty,
                            byte shape,
                            byte width,
                            byte height,
                            byte[][] grid,
                            int mines,
                            List<MouseListenerForGamePanel.Action> actions)
Play a JMines Video using a given list of actions.

Parameters:
difficulty - A byte defining the difficulty used in the video has been saved (beginner, intermediate, expert or custom).
shape - The tiles shape used in the video (triangular, square, hexagonal, etc.).
width - The number of columns in the video grid.
height - The number of lines in the video grid.
grid - A bytes array defining which tiles contain a mine (a tile contains a mine if the byte value of the grid array is 1).
mines - The number of mines contained in the video grid.
actions - The List of game actions to play.

manageSmiley

public final void manageSmiley()
Manage and set the correct smiley to the center button of the top panel.
